1.name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
1.description: Exiled into the dangerous forest by her wicked stepmother, a princess is rescued by seven dwarf miners who make her part of their household.

2.name: A Star Is Born
2.description: A young woman comes to Hollywood with dreams of stardom, but achieves them only with the help of an alcoholic leading man whose best days are behind him.

3.name: La Grande Illusion
3.description: During WWI, two French soldiers are captured and imprisoned in a German P.O.W. camp. Several escape attempts follow until they are eventually sent to a seemingly inescapable fortress.

4.name: Lost Horizon
4.description: A plane crash delivers a group of people to the secluded land of Shangri-La - but is it the miraculous utopia it appears to be?

5.name: The Good Earth
5.description: Although married Chinese farmers Wang and O-Lan initially experience success, their lives are complicated by declining fortunes and lean times, as well as the arrival of the beautiful young Lotus.

6.name: The Awful Truth
6.description: Unfounded suspicions lead a married couple to begin divorce proceedings, whereupon they start undermining each other's attempts to find new romance.

7.name: Dead End
7.description: The lives of a young man and woman, an infamous gangster and a group of street kids converge one day in a volatile New York City slum.

8.name: Stage Door
8.description: A chronicle of the ambitions, dreams, and disappointments of aspiring actresses who all live in the same boarding house.

9.name: The Life of Emile Zola
9.description: The biopic of the famous French muckraking writer and his involvement in fighting the injustice of the Dreyfuss Affair.

10.name: Captains Courageous
10.description: A spoiled brat who falls overboard from a steamship gets picked up by a fishing boat, where he's made to earn his keep by joining the crew in their work.

11.name: Topper
11.description: A fun-loving couple, finding that they died and are now ghosts, decide to shake up the stuffy lifestyle of a friend of theirs.

12.name: Shall We Dance
12.description: A budding romance between a ballet master and a tap dancer becomes complicated when rumors surface that they're already married.

13.name: Young and Innocent
13.description: A man on the run from a murder charge enlists a beautiful stranger who must put herself at risk for his cause.

14.name: Heidi
14.description: A plucky little orphan girl gets dumped abruptly into her gruff, hermit grandfather's care, then later gets retaken and delivered as a companion for an injured girl.

15.name: Saratoga
15.description: After winning a stud farm in lieu of gambling debts, bookie Duke Bradley turns an eye to the daughter of the now deceased gambler and her millionaire fiancée.

16.name: You Only Live Once
16.description: The public defender's secretary and an ex-convict get married and try to make a life together, but a series of disasters sends their lives spiraling out of control.

17.name: The Prisoner of Zenda
17.description: An Englishman on a Ruritarian holiday must impersonate the king when the rightful monarch, a distant cousin, is drugged and kidnapped.

18.name: Way Out West
18.description: Stanley and Ollie are enlisted to deliver the deed to a goldmine in a small village, only for it to be stolen.

19.name: Make Way for Tomorrow
19.description: An elderly couple are forced to separate when they lose their house and none of their five children will take both parents in.

20.name: Fire Over England
20.description: Queen Elizabeth I (Dame Flora Robson) is running this show. The men in her court should be thinking about how to add to the glory of the Elizabethan Age and how to foil those pesky Spanish ...                See full summary »

21.name: Pépé le Moko
21.description: A wanted gangster is both king and prisoner of the Casbah. He is protected from arrest by his friends, but is torn by his desire for freedom outside. A visiting Parisian beauty may just tempt his fate.

22.name: Stella Dallas
22.description: A working-class woman is willing to do whatever it takes to give her daughter a socially promising future.

23.name: Black Legion
23.description: When a hard-working machinist loses a promotion to a Polish-born worker, he is seduced into joining the secretive Black Legion, which intimidates foreigners through violence.

24.name: Marked Woman
24.description: A crusading DA persuades a clip joint "party girl" to testify against her mobster boss after her innocent sister is accidentally murdered during one of his unsavory "parties".

25.name: The Prince and the Pauper
25.description: A poor boy named Tom Canty and the Prince of Wales exchange identities but events force the pair to experience each other's lives as well.

26.name: Nothing Sacred
26.description: An eccentric woman learns she is not dying of radium poisoning as earlier assumed, but when she meets a reporter looking for a story, she feigns sickness again for her own profit.

27.name: The Hurricane
27.description: A Polynesian sailor -- unjustly imprisoned after defending himself against a colonial bully -- is relentlessly persecuted by his island's martinet French governor.

28.name: A Day at the Races
28.description: A veterinarian posing as a doctor and a race-horse owner and his friends struggle to help keep a sanitarium open with the help of a misfit race-horse.

29.name: Kid Galahad
29.description: Fight promoter Nick Donati grooms a bellhop as a future champ, but has second thoughts when the 'kid' falls for his sister.

30.name: Night Must Fall
30.description: When a rich but cantankerous dowager on an isolated estates hires an engaging handyman, her niece/companion becomes suspicious of his motives.

31.name: Wise Girl
31.description: Snooty heiress decides to track down her dead sister's kids, who are living a Bohemian life with their uncle in Greenwich Village. Once she finds them, she discovers that the Bohemian life ...                See full summary »

32.name: Easy Living
32.description: A wealthy banker throws his wife's expensive fur coat off the roof of a building; it lands on the head of a stenographer, leading to everyone assuming she is his mistress and has access to his millions.

33.name: A Damsel in Distress
33.description: Lady Alyce Marshmorton must marry soon, and the staff of Tottney Castle have laid bets on who she'll choose, with young Albert wagering on "Mr. X". After Alyce goes to London to meet a beau...                See full summary »

34.name: Wings of the Morning
34.description: First Technicolor movie shot in the British Isles, features Gypsies, horse racing, singing and romance.

35.name: Wee Willie Winkie
35.description: Priscilla Williams, a young girl living with her widowed mother and paternal grandfather at the post he commands in northern India, becomes enamored of military life and embroiled in brewing rebellion against the crown in the early 1900's.

36.name: They Won't Forget
36.description: A politically ambitious district attorney, unscrupulous tabloid journalists, and regional prejudice combine to charge a teacher with the murder of his student.

37.name: Thoroughbreds Don't Cry
37.description: A cocky young jockey who gets mixed up with some crooked gamblers befriends an English lad with a fast horse and the niece of a woman who runs a boarding house for jockeys.

38.name: Broadway Melody of 1938
38.description: Steve Raleight wants to produce a show on Broadway. He finds a backer, Herman Whipple and a leading lady, Sally Lee. But Caroline Whipple forces Steve to use a known star, not a newcomer. ...                See full summary »

39.name: Elephant Boy
39.description: This black and white movie is based on Rudyard Kipling's "Toomai, of the Elephants", in which a small native lad claims he knows the congregating place of the elephant hordes.

40.name: Born to the West
40.description: Can Dare Rudd prove he is responsible enough to win the heart of Judy and also outwit the crooked saloon owner?

41.name: I, Claudius
41.description: The life and times of the Roman Emperor Claudius (10 B.C. to 54 A.D.).

42.name: Dark Journey
42.description: During World War I, a German spy and a French spy meet and fall in love.

43.name: True Confession
43.description: A lawyer defends his wife, a pathological liar, in a murder trial.

44.name: King Solomon's Mines
44.description: White hunter Allan Quartermain and his enigmatic guide help a young Irish woman locate her missing father in unexplored Darkest Africa.

45.name: Angel
45.description: A woman and her husband take separate vacations, and she falls in love with another man.

46.name: Double Wedding
46.description: Two sisters of differing temperaments, the younger's milquetoast fiancé, and a free-spirited artist in an auto trailer are all experiencing romantic complications.

47.name: Oh, Mr. Porter!
47.description: With the help of a relative, a hopeless railway employee is made stationmaster of Buggleskelly. Determined to make his mark, he devises a number of schemes to put Buggleskelly on the railway map, but instead falls foul of a gang of gun runners.

48.name: History Is Made at Night
48.description: A wealthy divorcée falls for a charming Parisian, but her insanely jealous ex-husband will do anything to get her back.

49.name: Swing High, Swing Low
49.description: A singer stranded in Panama moves in with an ex-soldier and his hypochondriac roommate; she and the former fall in love, but their romance is threatened by work and the arrival of an old flame.

50.name: Something to Sing About
50.description: A New York bandleader journeys to Hollywood when he is offered a contract with a studio, but he is determined to do things his way and not theirs.
